title: Drake Maye says he’s focusing on something bigger than an MVP trophy
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "At the end of the day, winning the Super Bowl is the biggest thing.
" Drake Maye is still in the running for MVP honors this season.
John Tlumacki/The Boston Globe With just three weeks left in the NFL regular season, Drake Maye remains in the running for the league’s MVP award.

title: What Brad Stevens said of Celtics’ trade deadline plans
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics "I think that we’re all still trying to figure out who we are and what we can be.
We will not put a ceiling on this group.
" Brad Stevens could be active before the NBA trade deadline in February.

title: Patriots defense takes a major hit in first injury report ahead of Ravens game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Five starters on New England's defense were missing from Wednesday's practice.
Robert Spillane was spotted in a boot on Wednesday at Gillette Stadium.
AP Photo/Greg M.

title: Brad Stevens gives update on ‘long progression’ ahead of potential Jayson Tatum return
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics Tatum has a number of thresholds to meet before he can return to the court, Stevens said.
Jayson Tatum AP Photo/Charles Krupa The Celtics appear to be staying afloat without Jayson Tatum so far.
They’re tied for fourth in the Eastern Conference through 26 games, and they’ve won seven of their last ten.

title: Tom Brady offered Patrick Mahomes advice on how to handle ACL recovery
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "The only thing you can do it focus on what's ahead of you and not look back," Brady said.
Tom Brady (left) and Patrick Mahomes (right) Matthew J.
Lee/The Boston Globe Tom Brady praised Patrick Mahomes for his toughness during a recent episode of the “Let’s Go!

title: Vladislav Kolyachonok looking to find a regular home on Bruins’ blue line
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins “Whatever they tell me to do, I can do it.
" Defenseman Vladislav Kolyachonok saw action in 11 games this season for the Stars.
Jason Redmond /AP photo By Conor Ryan December 17, 2025 | 4:34 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Tell us: Have you seen the MBTA’s holiday trains?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tell Us This holiday season, one six-car Orange Line and two Green Line cars are dressed up for the holidays.
The MBTA's Chief Operating Officer Ryan Coholan dressed as Santa Claus (center) in 2024, while operating a Green Line train out of North Station.
Several train cars on the Green Line Extension and Orange Line were decorated for the holidays again in December 2025.

title: N.H. woman sentenced to life in prison for fatally stabbing brother-in-law at Boston hotel
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime Ren Rodgers, 28, was convicted of killing 21-year-old Christopher Kellar.
She will be eligible for parole after 18 years.

By Abby Patkin December 17, 2025 | 4:06 PM 2 minutes to read A New Hampshire woman was sentenced to life in prison with the possibility of parole Wednesday after she was convicted of fatally stabbing her brother-in-law in 2021.

title: Plane crashes into parking lot in Nashua N.H., police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Local News The plane, carrying only a pilot, crashed into the parking lot of 45 Cannongate Road, Sergeant John Cinelli said.
By Sana Muneer December 17, 2025 | 4:04 PM Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A plane crashed into a parking lot in Nashua Wednesday afternoon, Nashua police said.

title: New Cambridge School Committee member signed agreement to never work for the city
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Luisa de Paula Santos resigned from Cambridge Public Schools, which she will now oversee as a member of the Cambridge School Committee.
Luisa de Paula Santos.
Courtesy of Marcia Lopes de Mello By Molly Farrar December 17, 2025 | 3:51 PM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
